dialogue.String: This area is off-limits to...oh, you've brought the report from the Zeruhn Mines.I'll take that.1�
This was your first mission, wasn't it? Good work.Normally, we--1�
Sir Lucius! How may I help you?1�
Naji...you mentioned a report?1�
Yes, sir! This adventurer just brought the last one.I was going to bring them all to you later, sir.1�
Show it to me.1�
So...more and more Galka are starting to believe in their Talekeeper's return.1�
The Talekeeper, sir?But I thought that was just some Galka myth, sir.1�
If that were only true... I've received reports that the Talekeeper is already back among them.1�
These reports...keep bringing them to me, Naji.We would not want to bother the president with such trivial matters.1�
Yes, sir!1�
As for you, I know you have not been in Bastok long, so I will give you some advice.1�
It is neither customary nor polite to open sealed documents prior to their delivery.Remember that if you wish to stay in Bastok.1�
As for you, adventurer, you have done well.Bastok needs more people like you.1�
Wow! Not many people get to speak to Sir Lucius after their first mission. He must see something in you. Keep up the good work!1�
Yeah, what do you want?I'm a little busy right now.1�
Hmm? Yeah, I'm Cid.Oh, you're here about the mission!Right, I was expecting you.1�
Hey, Raibaht! Bring the thingamajig over here.1�
This is only your second mission, huh?Most of the young ones in Bastok don't have the guts to go adventuring, so I'm counting on you. Do your best, hear?1�
Well, this mission's not all that tough.You just have to go out...1�
...Raibaht, old buddy, if you brought the thing, don't just stand there, say something!1�
...I brought the thing.1�
Gah!If you don't quit that, I'm gonna start calling you ��Silent Mountain�� or something!1�
You would not, Chief. You are not like the others.That is why I work for you.1�
Sheesh...I like the guy--he works hard, he's thorough in his research and all--but if only he was a little more talkative, you know?1�
Anyway, here's what I want you to do. Take this 3���� to the Dangruf Wadi near South Gustaberg.1�
Try to find a place in the Wadi where this 3���� changes color.That's all.1�
What is it for? Well, in order for you to understand, I'd have to give you some lessons on the accrual patterns of sediments in the Wadi and the formation of gas pockets in the soil...1�
...You're getting a blank expression on your face. I know, I know, you didn't become an adventurer to study geology, right?Don't worry, it's nothing dangerous, so get going!1�
Ah, you're back!Let's see it. Hmm...red, as I thought.And a very strong reaction, too.1�
Then we should be able to use it...but we must make sure to minimize the ecological repercussions of such work...1�
Busy as always, Chief?1�
Volker, you old dog!When did you get back?1�
You must have some great stories to tell!Come on, out with them!1�
Chief, were you not speaking to this person before I interrupted?1�
Oh, right! Sorry.It's been a long time since he and I had a chance to talk.1�
Let me introduce myself.I am Volker, captain of the Mythril Musketeers.1�
You must be an adventurer...and new to Bastok too, are you not?I hope you do well. Bastok is in need of good people.1�
Yeah, for your second mission, you've done very well.I'll tell the guard at the gatehouse myself.1�
Well, I should be going.I will drop by again later, Chief.1�
I must go lend an ear to the president's gripes again.1�
Come on, he needs support, especially from you.It might not look like it, but I'm sure he's doing his best.1�
I'm sorry to have kept you here so long. Thanks again, and good work.Oh, and I might need your help again soon, so stay in touch!1�
Oooh! You've brought me  $����!I just love these cooked--1�
Uh...I mean, this is very important to the safety of Bastok, yes!It's imperative that you do not tell anyone you've brought this to me!1�
You have proven yourself to be a great patriot!I will be following your career with great interest.1�
Senator, sir...you still haven't handed in your orders regarding--1�
Iron Eater! Wh-what are you doing here!?I am in the middle of a very important--1�
How did you know? Uh...I mean, get out!It's going to spoil if I don't cook it--1�
<Sigh> Bon appetit, sir.Just hand in the papers to one of the Musketeers as soon as you're done.1�
Tell me...do you not sometimes wonder if these missions are truly worth your time?1�
Do you think missions are a waste of time?Yes, I do.No, I don't.1�
Hah hah hah.You are an honest one. But it is not something you should say to a Mythril Musketeer, especially when you are near the President's Office.1�
I see.I must apologize. It is unbecoming of a Mythril Musketeer to ask such questions.1�
Either way, there is no question that you have done a great deal for the prosperity of Bastok, and that you will in the future as well.1�
I must try to do the same...1�
Good to see you again.I hear you're going overseas.1�
Usually, I would be giving you your orders, but this time, the president's aide wants to meet with you in person.1�
This is only your second mission, huh?Most of the young ones in Bastok don't have the guts to go adventuring, so I'm counting on you. Do your best, hear?1�
The client sent an invalid value to the server!1�
